wikipedia_page.main: Helen Margaret Muspratt (13 May 1907 – 29 July 2001) was a British photographer.

response: Ramsey married Lettice Baker in September 1925, the wedding taking place in a Register Office since Ramsey was, as his wife described him, a ‘militant atheist'. The marriage produced two daughters. After Ramsey's death, Lettice Ramsey opened a photography studio in Cambridge with photographer Helen Muspratt. Despite his atheism, Ramsey was "quite tolerant" towards his brother when the latter decided to become a priest in the Church of England."He was certainly sorry that I went on being religious; he was sorry that I decided to become a priest in the Church of England; sorry indeed, but quite tolerant." Quoted in Mellor, "Ramsey", p. 255

To support her family, Ramsey took a photography course at Regent Street Polytechnic. Introduced to photographer Helen Muspratt by artist  F. H. "Fra" Newbery, the two women opened a studio together in Cambridge in 1932.
